>>>>> "Yannick" == Yannick Loiseau <yloiseau@...> writes:

    Yannick> I'm modeling a search engine in Rest. Queries are more
    Yannick> complex than just a list of keywords, and should be
    Yannick> represented in xml. So my question is: how could I send
    Yannick> the query to the server ?  The obvious solution would be
    Yannick> a POST, but as it is a search, GET would be more
    Yannick> convenient?  

convenient? You mean more RESTful? I think the names of verbs is pure
ideology. It's the ideas that count. If POST works better for pure
technical reasons, use POST.

Best would be probably a hidden field, name "method" or so that really
indicates what you wanted. You need to have it for PUT/DELETE anyway.
